thread.title: Cold facts: With 4-1 win, Stars sweep Penguins for second consecutive year
thread.title_full: Cold facts: With 4-1 win, Stars sweep Penguins for second consecutive year | Dallas Morning News

author: Mike Heika
title: Cold facts: With 4-1 win, Stars sweep Penguins for second consecutive year
text:
Click here to view the box score.
Stars 4, Penguins 1 Three Stars
1. Antti Niemi, Stars -- Solid 33 saves.
2. John Klingberg, Stars -- Goal and assist
3. Jason Spezza, Stars -- Goal, plus-2
Save of the Game
Pittsburgh's Evgeni Malkin broke in alone short-handed 2:30 into the game, and Stars goalie Antti Niemi calmly knocked away a wicked shot to keep the game scoreless. Niemi had several key saves before the Stars scored at the 10:55 mark of the first period.
Discuss
If Patrick Eaves (lower body injury) is ready to play next week, do you send Radek Faksa back to the minors or do you keep him in the lineup and scratch someone else?
What does it mean?
Dallas is off to a 6-1-0 start and has been the better team in all six wins. Dallas is getting great even strength play, great special teams play and great goaltending all while showing impressive depth.
THE GOALS
Stars : Dallas defenseman Johnny Oduya flipped a floating shot on goal that sailed between a couple of sticks and past Pittsburgh goalie Marc-Andre Fleury at 10:55 of the first period. Stars 1, Penguins 0 .
Stars : With Dallas on the power play, defenseman John Klingberg slid across the blueline, stepped into the left circle and snapped a shot through a Jamie Benn screen at 15:05 of the first period. Stars 2, Penguins 0 .
Stars : Stars center Jason Spezza stepped in front of a David Perron pass attempt, walked down the slot and whipped a shot in for his fifth goal of the season at 5:07 of the second period. Stars 3, Penguins 0 .
Penguins : Pittsburgh forward Nick Bonino took a puck away from Stars defenseman Jordie Benn in a battle behind the Stars net, then walked out and snapped in a goal at 11:20 of the second period. Stars 3, Penguins 1 .
Stars : Kingberg flipped a shot on net from distance that Valeri Nichushkin deflected on goal. Mattias Janmark then swooped in and potted the rebound at the 13:02 mark of the second period for his third goal of the season. Stars 4, Penguins 1 .
